references.reason: This paper introduces Neural ODEs, a foundational model for continuous-time modeling that the current paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Latent ordinary differential equations for irregularly-sampled time series
references.reason: This paper extends ODEs to handle irregularly sampled data, a significant improvement relevant to the clinical time series focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Scalable gradients and variational inference for stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper presents methods for training Neural SDEs efficiently, addressing a key challenge that the current paper aims to overcome with its proposed TFM.
This paper introduces denoising diffusion models, which are relevant to the simulation-free training approach of the current paper.
This paper introduces the flow matching technique, which is directly leveraged by the current paper's proposed TFM method.
